@ProfJennyGamble @alisonleary1 @sajidjavid @TheQNI Yes. Some employers have increased to 79p per mile, released the cap at 3000 miles (when the mileage reimbursement goes down to 20p per mile) and are paying forward to prevent cash flow problems. Others are silent on the challenge atm.

@Spence1Kate @sajidjavid @TheQNI A national approach to the solutions would be good. Paying forward, increasing to 79p per mile and deleting the 3000 mile cap seems like a national solution.

@insightgenie üòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇ I failed to find the spare camping stove in the shed - only the gas - but survived very happily on cheese & biscuits & a flask of hot water. Kept warm clearing the garden of debris for a couple of hours too - no digital connectivity needed for that!

@Crouchendtiger7 Thanks Andrea - all good now! Warming up after 36 hours of no power - and a complete disconnect from the world with no wifi, landline & mobile - & my first weekend alone after 2 years! My heart goes out to those who live alone & have another night of darkness, cold & no phone.
@cherylsmith1 Thanks Cheryl - all good now. Made me realise how much we all depend on digital, wifi and mobile connections - and what we have to do as nurses in the community when there is none!

@alisonleary1 All good thanks and super grateful for hot water and heating - and wifi! It was 36 hours too not 18. üòÇ
@fhussain73 Can't tell you how excited I am to boil a kettle and turn on the heating!! Thinking of those still without power though...
@RivkahMiar Yes all good TY but should have said 36 hours not 18!! Lots of reflection on dependencies and the value of candles, matches, torches and flasks!
